intro: Phlomoides adylovii, commonly known as the Adylov's phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves.
